column4: it's a collection of most of Debian main compiled against Ubuntu
note that universe is totally unsupported
whats so special about universe? (sorry for the newbness)
universe is basically the set of everything we didn't decide to take for our smaller set of supported packages
so in other words should i leave it be? lol
it's nothing to do with latest, more "different"
is there a ubuntu guide to installing java?
not that I know of yet
do you have two sources.list entries, one 'main restricted' and the other 'main restricted universe', but otherwise identical?
ok, change 'main restricted universe' to just 'universe'
may I ask how do I make totem play avi files?
you missed 'install' in there, but yeah
